results.title: Speaking of Mary
results.creator_credit: Annie Bolitho, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Annie Bolitho tells of some of the questions that trouble her in her job as a funeral celebrant. How well does she know the person she’s remembering. It makes her wonder how well she knew her mother. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Annie Bolitho, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Annie Bolitho tells of some of the questions that trouble her in her job as a funeral celebrant. How well does she know the person she’s remembering. results.title: The Sinking home
results.creator_credit: Cameron Sugden, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Cam Sugden pays tribute to Mary, the matriarch of a poor Phillippino household in Manila. Despite living in a slum, Mary has endeavoured to create a large cocoon to protect her family. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cameron Sugden, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Cam Sugden pays tribute to Mary, the matriarch of a poor Phillippino household in Manila. results.title: People in red hats
results.creator_credit: Jane Curtis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jane Curtis reflects on how she spent her childhood sitting in the loungeroom of her grandparents home. As her family spoke in a language she didn’t understand, Curtis was transfixed by the painting that hung on her grandparent’s wall. Only as an adult would she discover the mysteries that painting held. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Curtis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Jane Curtis reflects on how she spent her childhood sitting in the loungeroom of her grandparents home. As her family spoke in a language she didn’t understand, Curtis was transfixed by the painting that hung on her grandparent’s wall. Only as an adult would she discover the mysteries that painting held. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.

results.title: Rhonda’s story : spoken by Ada Peterson
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.

While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.

results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: From Riverbank to Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Ceciline Biles, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
